title: New York Lawyers’ Guilty Plea Postponed in Molotov Cocktail Case
sub_head: Case involves federal charges for throwing makeshift explosives at an empty police car during a protest against police brutality
body:
Two lawyers expected to plead guilty Thursday to federal charges involving throwing a Molotov cocktail at an empty New York City police car last year are now scheduled to plead guilty on Oct. 20.
The charges against Urooj Rahman and Colinford Mattis—both New York-based attorneys in their early 30s—drew attention to violence during the demonstrations that followedGeorge Floyd’s murder in police custody. They were among a handful of people who face federal prosecution for arson and use of explosive devices during protests sparked by the killing of Mr. Floyd.
